titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bowyear, East India Company Resident at Bushire, and his assistant, John Sebastian Natter, to Thomas Hodges, President and Governor at Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is an update on the situation at Bushire and covers several subjects:the trade in Carmenia wool and how it has been affected by revolt in the KirmƒÅn region;Benjamin Jervis' attempts to obtain grants to settle on the island of Busheab [Lavan];the proposed exchange of woollens for raw silk with Karim Khan;the poor state of trade due to the Khan's anger with the English.
